item.title: 摩根大通 5 亿美元的 EA 债务费用吸引了渴望分一杯羹的银行
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Banks are vying for a slice of the roughly $500 million of fees tied to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s $20 billion debt financing backing the take-private of Electronic Arts Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 随着购物者转向更高级的特产鸡蛋，Cal-Maine 品牌鸡蛋价格暴跌
item.description: 美国最大的鸡蛋生产商 Cal-Maine Foods Inc. 注意到了市场上的一个主要趋势：消费者正在转向他们认为更可持续的高端品种。【原文：Cal-Maine Foods Inc., the top US egg producer, is noticing a major trend in the market: consumers are shifting to fancier varieties that they consider to be more sustainable.】

item.title: First Brands 贷款人出资 44 亿美元避免清算
item.description: 据法庭文件显示，First Brands Group LLC 的众多贷款人 "以迅雷不及掩耳之势 "提供了 44 亿美元的破产保护融资，公司顾问称，这将使这家汽车零部件供应商在匆忙申请破产后避免清算。【原文：A broad group of First Brands Group LLC lenders “have worked at lightening-speed” to provide $4.4 billion of Chapter 11 financing that company advisers said will allow the auto-parts supplier to avoid liquidation after its rushed bankruptcy filing, according to court papers.】

item.title: 欧洲检察官调查北方数据公司 5 亿欧元收购 GPU 案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，一项刑事调查上周突袭了北方数据公司（Northern Data AG）的办公室，重点调查该公司是否非法为价值约 5 亿欧元（约合 5.86 亿美元）的高性能计算芯片申请减税。【原文：A criminal investigation that led to raids of Northern Data AG’s offices last week is focused on whether the company illegally claimed a tax break on about €500 million ($586 million) worth of high-performance computing chips, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国电力创二十年新低，冬季来临前供应充足
item.description: 法国上月强劲的核电和可再生能源产出将当日平均电价推至二十年来 9 月份的最低点，凸显了供暖季开始后的健康供应状况。【原文：France’s strong nuclear and renewables output last month pushed average day-ahead power prices to the lowest for a September in two decades, highlighting a healthy supply picture as the heating season starts.】

item.title: 钻石背能源公司首席执行官称被视为二叠纪页岩收购目标是件好事
item.description: 钻石背能源公司（Diamondback Energy Inc.首席执行官凯斯-范特霍夫（Kaes Van't Hof）说，在这家页岩钻探公司斥资 320 亿美元大肆收购之后，作为可能的收购目标 "成为对话对象是件好事"。【原文：Diamondback Energy Inc. Chief Executive Officer Kaes Van’t Hof says it’s “good to be in the conversation” as a possible takeover target after the shale driller’s own $32 billion acquisition spree.】

item.title: 欧洲最大养老基金撤资卡特彼勒股票
item.description: 欧洲最大的养老基金出售了其在卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.【原文：Europe’s biggest pension fund sold its equity stake in Caterpillar Inc. amid backlash about the heavy-equipment maker’s links to Israel’s war in Gaza.】

item.title: 微软提升销售主管阿尔索夫，帮助纳德拉释放压力
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）正在进行重组，让其长期以来的销售主管负责市场营销和运营，目的是让首席执行官萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）和他的工程领导人腾出更多时间从事技术工作。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is giving its longtime sales chief oversight of marketing and operations in a reorganization designed to free up Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella and his engineering leaders to devote more time to technical work.】

item.title: 荷兰养老金巨头确认 2026 年迁址，加大对陡坡机的投注力度
item.description: 在荷兰一家大型养老基金发出明年将转向新系统的信号后，交易商加大了对欧洲更陡峭利率曲线的押注。【原文：Traders stepped up wagers on a steeper European interest-rate curve, after a major Dutch pension fund signaled that it’s on track to shift to a new system next year.】

item.description:
彭博资讯的分析师从数千家上市公司中筛选出少数几家值得投资者关注的公司。【原文：

item.title: 前德意志银行经理在伦敦起诉德国贷款机构欺诈
item.description: 本周公开的一份文件显示，德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的一名前经理在伦敦一家法院起诉其前雇主商业欺诈。【原文：An ex-manager of Deutsche Bank AG sued his former employer in a London court over commercial fraud, according to a filing made public this week.】

item.title: 微软将 Xbox 游戏通行证顶级订阅费提高 50%至 30 美元
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）正在升级其 Xbox Game Pass 订阅服务，增加了游戏目录和福利，同时将顶级计划的价格提高了 50%。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is upgrading its Xbox Game Pass subscription service with an expanded catalog and perks, while raising the price of the top-tier plan by 50%.】

item.title: 美国制造业活动连续第七个月萎缩
item.description: 9 月份，美国工厂活动连续第七个月萎缩，反映出订单减少，进一步证明制造业缺乏动力。【原文：US factory activity shrank in September for a seventh consecutive month, reflecting a pullback in orders and adding to evidence manufacturing is lacking traction.】

item.title: 意大利预算草案规定 2025 年赤字将达到欧盟 3% 的上限
item.description: 据熟悉意大利财政计划最新草案的人士透露，意大利今年的预算赤字将达到欧盟规定的产出 3% 的上限。【原文：Italy’s budget deficit will match the European Union’s 3%-of-output ceiling already this year, according to people familiar with the latest draft of the country’s finance plan.】

item.title: 政府开始关门，股市下跌；美洲锂业飙升
item.description: 由于政府关门加剧了市场的风险厌恶情绪，美国股市在 10 月份以红盘开局。【原文：US equities started October in the red as a government shutdown fueled a risk-off move in markets.】

item.title: 博鳌亚洲论坛对 9 月份创纪录的公司债券狂潮感到惊讶
item.description: 9 月份，公司在美国投资级市场上的借款额达到创纪录的 2,070 亿美元，超过了华尔街最大的债务承销商美国银行公司的预期。【原文：Companies borrowed a record $207 billion in the US investment-grade market in September, more than Wall Street’s top underwriter of the debt Bank of America Corp., had expected.】

item.title: 货币套利使阿根廷米莱公司每月损失 20 亿美元
item.description: 农产品出口美元的暂时激增促使阿根廷人购买廉价的绿卡，这消耗了哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政府正在努力重建的储备。【原文：A temporary surge in farm-export dollars has prompted Argentines to purchase cheap greenbacks, draining the very reserves President Javier Milei’s government is trying to rebuild.】

item.title: 欧佩克+增加供应，沙特石油出口飙升至 18 个月新高
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯 9 月份的原油出口量跃升至 18 个月来的最高水平，这表明沙特在欧佩克+增产中所占的份额开始冲击全球市场。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s crude exports leaped to the highest for 18 months in September, a sign that the kingdom’s share of OPEC+ output hikes is starting to hit global markets.】

item.title: 赛勒有望免征 15%的公司税，战略上升
item.description: 由迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）创建的比特币财务公司 Strategy Inc. 表示将不再缴纳美国企业替代性最低税，该公司股价在周三的盘前交易中最高上涨了 3.7%。【原文：Strategy Inc. shares rose as much as 3.7% in premarket trading Wednesday after the Bitcoin treasury company founded by Michael Saylor said that it will no longer be subject to the US corporate alternative minimum tax.】

item.title: 火箭公司以 142 亿美元完成对库珀先生的收购
item.description: 房屋贷款公司 Rocket Cos.以 142 亿美元的价格完成了对抵押贷款服务公司库珀先生集团公司（Mr. Cooper Group Inc.【原文：Home lender Rocket Cos. completed its purchase of mortgage servicer Mr. Cooper Group Inc. for $14.2 billion, a price tag 51% higher than the valuation announced in March.】

item.title: 谷歌通过新款摄像头、门铃和扬声器将双子座人工智能带入家庭
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司周三推出了一系列新的 Nest 品牌硬件，就在亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）举行自己的产品展示会的前一天，两家公司都在争夺将人工智能更深入地整合到整个智能家居中。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google introduced a range of new Nest-branded hardware on Wednesday, just a day after Amazon.com Inc. held its own product showcase, as both companies vie to more deeply integrate artificial intelligence throughout the smart home.】

item.title: 美元暴跌使外汇储备占比降至 30 年最低点
item.description: 外国中央银行库房中的美元比例达到了 1995 年以来的最低点，这一变化是由货币急剧下跌而不是持有量减少造成的。【原文：The proportion of dollars in the coffers of foreign central banks hit its lowest mark since 1995, a shift driven by a steep decline in the currency rather than a reduction in holdings.】

item.title: 元开始使用聊天机器人对话定位广告
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司不久将开始利用与其人工智能聊天机器人的互动，更有效地定制人们在 Facebook 和 Instagram 上看到的内容和广告。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. will soon start using interactions with its AI chatbot to more effectively tailor the content and advertising that people see on Facebook and Instagram.】

item.title: 亚马逊针对注重价格的购物者推出杂货品牌
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）推出了一个自有品牌，提供一系列价格大多低于 5 美元的食品杂货，以吸引受通货膨胀影响的购物者。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. launched a private-label brand that offers a range of grocery items largely priced below $5 in a bid to attract inflation-stung shoppers.】

item.title: 印度家庭一年来价格压力有所缓解
item.description: 印度中央银行进行的调查显示，印度家庭预计，在当前价格上涨之后，未来三到十二个月的价格压力将趋于缓和。【原文：Indian households expect price pressures to moderate over the next three to 12 months after rising in the current period, according to surveys conducted by the country’s central bank.】

item.title: ADP 报告显示劳动力疲软，美国国债大涨
item.description: 在一项衡量私营部门就业的指标大幅下滑后，美国国债跳涨，导致交易商增加了对美联储今年降息的押注。【原文：US Treasuries jumped after a measure of private sector jobs plummeted, leading traders to add to bets on interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve this year.】

item.title: 数据调整后的 ADP 报告显示美国企业裁员 3.2 万人
item.description: 美国公司 9 月份的薪资出乎意料地下降，至少部分原因是数据分析出现了问题。【原文：Payrolls at US companies unexpectedly dropped in September, due at least in part to issues with data analysis.】

item.title: 中国电动车市场竞争激烈，比亚迪销量下滑
item.description: 电动汽车巨头比亚迪公司的月销售额出现了18个多月以来的首次下滑，尽管该公司的国内竞争对手在中国市场的激烈竞争中报告了强劲的增长。【原文：Electric vehicle juggernaut BYD Co.’s monthly sales fell for the first time in more than 18 months even as the company’s domestic rivals reported strong gains amid fierce competition in the Chinese market.】

item.title: 谷歌欧洲区负责人呼吁修改 "有问题 "的欧盟规则
item.description: 谷歌在欧洲的最高负责人表示，欧洲大陆应该简化复杂而相互冲突的人工智能和技术规则，因为硅谷最大的公司抱怨这些规则影响了他们在欧盟开展业务的能力。【原文：Google’s top executive in Europe said the continent should simplify complex and conflicting rules on artificial intelligence and technology as Silicon Valley’s biggest companies gripe about their impact on their ability to do business in the EU.】

item.title: 土耳其 Vestel 公司正在商谈将里拉贷款换成硬通货
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，土耳其 Vestel Elektronik 公司正在与贷款机构商谈对其部分贷款进行再融资，因为这家家电制造商正在与两位数的利率和高杠杆率作斗争。【原文：Turkey’s Vestel Elektronik is in talks with lenders to refinance some of its loans, as the home-appliance maker struggles with double-digit interest rates and high leverage, according to people familiar with the matter.】
